item.title: Publications and Preprints
item.description: Publications On the Multi-User Security of Short Schnorr Signatures with Preprocessing. with Jeremiah Blocki. EUROCRYPT 2022 [pdf] [abstract] The Schnorr signature scheme is an efficient digital signature scheme with short signature lengths, i.e., $4k$-bit signatures for $k$ bits of security. A Schnorr signature $\sigma$ over a group of size $p\approx 2^{2k}$ consists of a tuple $(s,e)$, where $e \in \lbrace 0,1 \rbrace^{2k}$ is a hash output and $s\in \mathbb{Z}_p$ must be computed using the secret key.
